reviews.review_text: Dispenser of Justice, Vanquisher of Evil, and Hero to the Downtrodden, DeathSpank returns in this classic adventure to fight his sworn enemy, the Anti-Spank! The game embodies a variety of classic RPG elements, tons of loot and the same comedic touch as it predecesors. Tied together by the Hack'n'Slash approach, The Baconing is a must play for all RPG enthusiasts and DeathSpank followers.   +  Funny storyline  +  Funny take on protagonist  +  Classic RPG elements  +  Tons of loot and a multitude of equipment combos/sets  +  Touches a variety of topics like corruption, gambling, nuclear sex  +  Easy Achievements  +  Local Co-Op  -  No Trading Cards (Emotes/Backgrounds)     Personal Ranking:   7.5
I am all one for dry humor and breaking the 4th wall, and this game will deliver both and give you a swift kick in the rear if you get too side tracked... Which i tended to do alot  Enjoyable 7/10

The Baconing is a sequel to DeathSpank. It's a cartoony, colorful action adventure game with gruesome humor. Fart jokes agogo as Deathspank fights an army of undead cyborgs to destroy some sacred thongs.   It's absurd, it's ridiculous. It's also colorful and fun and reminds me of some fo the more twisted cartoons of my youth like Ren and Stimpy, Invader Zim and The Grim Adventures of Billy and Mandy.   The Baconing is a pretty simple game at its core, but has more complex equipment and item systems than what I was expecting. On the one hand it's kind of a button masher, but some fo the mechanics are overly complex for such a game.   It might be your thing if you like hack and slash adventures with sophmoric toilet humor, but it just didn't do it for me.

I can't recommend this one. The story is ok in an over-the-top ridiculous kind of way, some of it is sort of funny. The RPG elements are super light, the loot system is very shallow to the point that you can essentially ignore it. After the first zone you realize that each zone is going to follow the same exact formula. Some quests have you running back through areas you already cleared, which at times can seem like an annoying way to extend the hours the game has to offer.   The worst part about this game is that the combat is extremely clumsy feeling. You must be quick and have timing down with your shield bash to win in the encounters, but the inputs feel laggy and you often miss the enemies for no good reason. Its the main part of the game, and it is implemented badly. This makes the game pretty challenging at times. Challenging is fine, but challenging because the controls are bad is not.   Overall, everything feels rushed. I had heard good things about this series, but this is not the one to get into.

Excellent dialog, story, and charming graphics make up for what can only be described as mediocre mechanics, it's a hack and slash that will frustrate the hell out of you with collection quests and side missions that add little to the overall game and serve only as a comedy tool. The co-op feature is not much to write home about, with a number of sidekicks available with a sort of reduced functionality, no gearing for sidekicks limits this a bit and minimizes loot fights. The game itself is rescued by its pacing and story and on the whole I would recommend it at a lower than usual price. not worth the £10 tag it puts forward.
Pick it up for less than $5. Otherwise don't bother.
Play this series. It will have you guffawing at the humor. Best played with a controller and a sense of humor.

This game, although charming, not too easy, and all in all create a pretty enjoyable expierence; the gameplay and the repetitiveness of all of the quests get pretty boring pretty quick. I havent tried DeathSpank or the sequal to that yet, but I imagine they are more fun than this one. 4.5/10

You know one Deathspank-game, you know them all, but if you like the Hack & Slay-esk gameplay, you will get great crazy humour, hilarious dialogues and enough content for your money. Buy for ~5$ each and you´ll have a great time!
Funtastic. When your done with intense Diablo gaming, this would be a nice game to relax down, have a few laughs and still practice your Diablo skills before the new one comes out.
Bacon is awesome, like this game.

Yes, it's still DeathSpank, but Ron Gilbert hasn't been part of this game. The humour suffers a bit from that fact, but there's still a fun funny moments when you meet some of the known characters from the first two games. However, this game works a bit different from the other DeathSpank titles because of their blocking system - expect to die a lot, especially in the beginning.
Great and funny game! Needs to play first parts =( 7/10.

Funny, cartoony, feel-good RPG game.  If you like these kind of games, the likes of Psychonauts, you'll like this.  Leveling up, new armors & weapons as upgrades with each level, health potions & such. The ususal RPG stuff.   I haven't played the previous 2 installments of DeathSpank, but I've read The Baconing is very similar to those. So take that into account.  Good, entertaining game.
